intro: Alsine dicranoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to sandy and coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dunes, gravelly slopes, and disturbed areas. Its rapid growth and ability to colonize harsh environments make it an important pioneer species in ecological succession. The plant's succulent leaves help it retain moisture in arid conditions, contributing to its survival in challenging habitats.
